docs.lead_paragraph: Cognizant Technology Solutions Corp struck its biggest deal on Monday, acquiring healthcare IT services provider TriZetto Corp for $2.7 billion to beef up its slowing healthcare business.

headline.main: Cognizant to Buy TriZetto to Boost Healthcare Business
headline.print_headline: Cognizant to Buy TriZetto to Boost Healthcare Business

docs.snippet: Cognizant Technology Solutions Corp struck its biggest deal on Monday, acquiring healthcare IT services provider TriZetto Corp for $2.7 billion to beef up its slowing healthcare business.

docs.lead_paragraph: Potential complications await consumers as President Barack Obama's health care law approaches its second open enrollment season, just two months away.

headline.main: Hurdles for Obama Health Law in 2nd Sign-Up Season
headline.print_headline: Hurdles for Obama Health Law in 2nd Sign-Up Season

docs.snippet: Potential complications await consumers as President Barack Obama's health care law approaches its second open enrollment season, just two months away.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of consumers risk losing financial aid for health care premiums under President Barack Obama's law unless they clear up lingering questions about their incomes, administration officials said Monday.

headline.main: Some Consumers Risk Losing Health Law Tax Credits
headline.print_headline: Some Consumers Risk Losing Health Law Tax Credits

docs.snippet: Thousands of consumers risk losing financial aid for health care premiums under President Barack Obama's law unless they clear up lingering questions about their incomes, administration officials said Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some of Kansas’ staunchest Republicans have found some of Gov. Sam Brownback’s measures to be too far to the right, and have endorsed Paul Davis, the Democratic candidate.

headline.main: Conservative Experiment Faces Revolt in Reliably Red Kansas
headline.print_headline: Conservative Experiment Faces Revolt in Reliably Red Kansas

docs.abstract: Some of Kansas' staunchest Republicans are turning away from Republican incumbent Gov Sam Brownback, due to drop in state revenue as result of Brownback's proudly conservative policies; revolt has boosted hopes of Democratic candidate Paul Davis, who has shot up in polls even though he has offered few specifics about how he would run the state.
docs.snippet: Some of Kansas’ staunchest Republicans have found some of Gov. Sam Brownback’s measures to be too far to the right, and have endorsed Paul Davis, the Democratic candidate.

docs.lead_paragraph: The rate of growth in the price of employer-based health coverage appears to be stabilizing.
docs.abstract: Editorial contends survey of more than 2,000 employers conducted by Kaiser Family Foundation and Health Research and Educational Trust has found encouraging indicators about employer-sponsored health insurance; notes in particular that price of employed-based coverage appears to be stabilizing.
docs.snippet: The rate of growth in the price of employer-based health coverage appears to be stabilizing.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials are encouraging consumers to revisit the federal marketplace to compare plans and ensure that they get the right amount of financial assistance in 2015.

headline.main: Health Law Has Caveat on Renewal of Coverage
headline.print_headline: Health Law Has Caveat on Renewal of Coverage

docs.abstract: Health insurance companies will soon send notices to millions of customers saying their coverage is being automatically renewed for 2015, along with financial assistance from federal government, but consumer advocates say there is potential for confusion, as much information might be out of date or misleading; Obama administration emphasizes consumers should revisit marketplace to ensure they are getting correct amount of financial assistance.
docs.snippet: Officials are encouraging consumers to revisit the federal marketplace to compare plans and ensure that they get the right amount of financial assistance in 2015.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: For more than three decades, the Highbridge Community Life Center was an esteemed link for waves of immigrants in the west Bronx neighborhood.

headline.main: A Vital Center for a Bronx Community Closes
headline.print_headline: A Lifeline for a Bronx Community Closes

docs.abstract: Side Street column on closing of Highbridge Community Life Center, has offered educational, citizenship and family and youth programs for over three decades; center is, one of the few beacons for waves of immigrants who settled in the High Bridge neighborhood in the west Bronx.
docs.snippet: For more than three decades, the Highbridge Community Life Center was an esteemed link for waves of immigrants in the west Bronx neighborhood.
